title: How to Pin and Unpin Messages on iPhone, iPad, Mac, & Android

steps.title: Open the Messages app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Messages app on your iPhone or iPad. If you've already pinned a contact in Messages, unpinning is easy.

steps.title: Long-press a pinned contact.
steps.content: Long-press a pinned contact. The conversation will appear, and a menu will pop up beneath it.

steps.title: Tap Unpin.
steps.content: Tap Unpin . This unpins the text conversation and returns your contact's name to your regular Messages list chronologically. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Unpin multiple text messages.
steps.content: Unpin multiple text messages. If you have more than one conversation pinned and want to remove multiple pins: Tap Edit at the top-left corner of the Messages app. Select Edit Pins . You'll see all your pinned contacts start to jiggle. Tap the minus sign on each contact you want to unpin.

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. If you want the contacts you text most to appear at the top of the Messages app, you can easily pin your text conversations. Tap the icon that looks like a chat bubble on a green background.

steps.title: Long-press a conversation.
steps.content: Long-press a conversation. A menu will pop up. [2] X Research source If you want to pin content within a message thread, like a link or a podcast, tap and hold the item you want to pin, then tap the pushpin icon. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Pin.
steps.content: Tap Pin . It's next to an icon of a pin. This adds your contact's photo to the top of the Messages app so you can always find them. To pin multiple conversations, tap Edit > Edit Pins and tap the pin icon next to each conversation you want to pin to the top. Alternatively, swipe right across a conversation to pin it. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Messages app on your Mac.
steps.content: Open the Messages app on your Mac. If you use Messages on your Mac laptop or desktop computer, you can easily pin and unpin text messages. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Control-click the text you want to unpin.
steps.content: Control-click the text you want to unpin. A menu will expand. If you want to unpin shared content, like an invitation or link, control-click the content you want to unpin instead, then select Unpin . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Unpin.
steps.content: Click Unpin . This brings the text conversation back to your regular list of text messages. Alternatively, you can click and drag the pinned conversation out of the top sidebar to quickly unpin it. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. If you text someone frequently, you can pin your conversation to the top of the Messages app so you can easily access their texts. Click the app icon that looks like a chat bubble on a green background to get started.

steps.title: Control-click a conversation.
steps.content: Control-click a conversation. A menu will appear. If you want to pin a message in the conversation that contains a link to a podcast, an invitation, or other Apple-specific content, just control-click the content you want to pin, then click Pin .

steps.title: Click Pin.
steps.content: Click Pin . Once you do this, you'll see the person's contact photo at the top of the Messages app. Alternatively, you can drag a conversation to the top of the list to pin it.

steps.title: Open Messages on your Samsung phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open Messages on your Samsung phone or tablet. Tap the app icon that looks like a chat bubble with lines on a blue background.

steps.title: Tap and hold the message you want to unpin.
steps.content: Tap and hold the message you want to unpin. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap More ⋮ at the bottom.
steps.content: Tap More ⋮ at the bottom. Additional options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Unpin from top.
steps.content: Tap Unpin from top . This will unpin the conversation. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. You can easily pin and unpin text messages on your Samsung Galaxy phone or tablet. Start by tapping the app icon that looks like a chat bubble with lines on it on a blue background.

steps.title: Tap and hold a message.
steps.content: Tap and hold a message. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap More ⋮ at the bottom.
steps.content: Tap More ⋮ at the bottom. Additional options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Pin to top.
steps.content: Tap Pin to top . On some devices, you'll see a pushpin icon instead. If you do, tap that. This will pin the conversation to the top of the list.

steps.title: Open the Messages app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Messages app on your Android. If you don't want a message to stay pinned to the top of the Messages app on in Google Messages, unpinning is simple.

steps.title: Tap and hold the conversation you want to unpin.
steps.content: Tap and hold the conversation you want to unpin. Depending on your model and version, you'll either see a menu or some icons appear at the top.

steps.title: Tap Unpin from top or the pushpin icon with a line through it.
steps.content: Tap Unpin from top or the pushpin icon with a line through it. This restores the text conversation to your message list chronologically.

steps.title: Open the Messages app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Messages app on your Android. If you're using a Google-branded Android phone or tablet, or you're using the Google Messages app on another Android, you can easily pin and unpin text messages to the top of the app. It is not possible to pin messages in the Google Messages app in some regions, including India. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap and hold the conversation you want to pin.
steps.content: Tap and hold the conversation you want to pin. Depending on your model and version, you'll either see a menu or some icons expand at the top.

steps.title: Tap Pin to top.
steps.content: Tap Pin to top . Depending on your model and version, you may need to tap a pushpin icon instead. This will pin the conversation to the top of the message list. [10] X Research source
